ref: 7963 palya n. ʻ sack for corn ʼ KātyŚr., palla -- 1 m. ʻ large granary ʼ Suśr., pallī -- 2 f. ʻ measure of grain ʼ KātyŚr. com. [EWA ii 235, 236 with lit. separates palya -- from palla -- 1. -- Cf. *palla -- 2?]
Pk. palia -- , palla -- , ˚aga -- m. ʻ round sack for grain ʼ;
S. palu m. ʻ place attached to a house for storing grain ʼ, palī f. ʻ a mat bag for grain ʼ;
L. pall, pallā m. ʻ stack of straw or grain, two concentric walls of grass ropes on masonry cylinder of a well between which earth from the well is placed ʼ;
P. pall f. ʻ large bamboo bin (holding 200 -- 300 maunds) ʼ, pallā ʻ cloth spread for holding grain ʼ;
khaś. pallā ʻ udder of cow or buffalo (as opposed to those of sheep and goats) ʼ;
khaś. pallā ʻ udder of cow or buffalo (as opposed to those of sheep and goats) ʼ;
Ku. pālī ʻ small wooden dish ʼ, pallo ʻ basket work interwoven with grass and leaves for thatching ʼ, palaṛo ʻ one of the baskets of a balance ʼ, palyālo ʻ a wooden vessel ʼ;
A. pal ʻ a bamboo basket for catching fish ʼ, palā ʻ rattan basket for pressing mustard oil ʼ;
B. pālaï ʻ granary, rick of corn, stack of straw or hay ʼ;
H. pālā m. ʻ stack of corn ʼ, pallā m. ʻ grain sack, cloth spread for grain ʼ;
G. pālī f. ʻ any measure of capacity, a measure of 4 seers ʼ.
